column5: Went out ice fishing yesterday for the first time in just about 25 years. The weather was great with mild temps and it snowed the whole time. Set up and drilled a couple holes with no luck.   No luck there so I moved and drilled acouple more holes.  Ended up catching seven small bluegill, all on a glow jig tipped with a spike.    Had a good time today  Whopper
Great report and pics Phil!!! How thick was the ice?... and how in the heck could the temps be mild if it was snowing???  Glad to see you got out and caught some fish!
Glen it was about 25F with just a slight breeze, warmest it has been in two weeks Couple of the holes I drilled were 10" to 12"
good for you whopper, glad to see ya got out and had some success.
Phil.the main thing is you had fun,and you caught some Bluegill,s to boot WTG.  Steve
Whaaaaaa...................how long??????????  I could probably go without pizza for that long, but not ice fishing  WTG Phil. Did you keep any for the pan?
